reviews.review_msg: Great lab prof, report sheets were clear except two that were hard. do well on those as well as lon capa. Most questions were from the pre lab lon capa. Lab exam was a bit challenging but it's only worth 30%. Mostly conceptual for lab

Legit the kindest man ever. So approachable, so sweet and helpful whenever you talk to him, if I could have him for labs forever I would be so happy. The final (aka midterm) was only out of 20 questions, but consisted of very reasonable questions. Great guy

Seems like a really great guy and will always help you with any questions you might have during the experiments. You can also tell he strives to ensure students understand concepts they may have difficulty with. The course was easy for the most part (occasional assignments were nothing to stress), however quizzes could be a bit tough at times.

I'll just say it again, Dr Mund is one of the best profs at SFU. This semester has been a bit tough since we had to write post-lab quizzes without previous LONCAPA practice but he takes the time to clarify questions that students had after the lab. He genuinely cares about his students and wants them to do well!
Great lab prof. Lab exam was crazy easy.

Had the best lab experience with him. You can easily ask him any questions during the lab and hell immediately help you. Make sure to read and understand the experiment before coming and do the loncapa for it. If you get stuck on a report sheet question read the intro for the experiment, it tells you how youre going to be solving the questions.

Dr. Mund is the man! Had him as a lab prof and I have to say, he's the only reason it was bearable. Always willing to asnwer questions and explains concepts really well! Lab final was absolutely brutal, but his scaling saved my life, whoever said he scales beautifully, you have it right on

Dr.Mund is a straight-up G. It has been only our third lab so far, but he is SO APPROACHABLE. I dropped chemistry labs a few times because the Chem profs at SFU are pretty condescending and talk to down you. Not this guy. For the first time in a long time, I am not nervous to go to my labs, and I don't feel nervous the night before. He is great.
he is by all means on your side. always cheerful, relaxed and make you enjoy the chem labs. i m so grateful that i got to have him this term. truly nice :)
His guy is awesome!!! He is very helpful and very laid back in the lab.  He is willing to answer any questions you may have.  Chemistry is fun and easy with this guy.
Not very helpful, seems grumpy when asked questions or instructions for lab. The final was geared towards memorizing the procedures of individual experiments.

She scaled the class down by A LOT for reference an 81 is a C+. We had no idea before the final that this was a possibility so I didn't put as much effort on the final as I had harder ones that same week. Went into the final with 92%. She isn't very approachable either. Avoid taking with her!

- downcurved last minute
- was rude to both students and her assistants 
- very disorganized 
- changed labs last minute
- marked our practical unfairly 
- hard to communicate in her emails 
- softcore bullies her own students when we needed help 
- snarky 

take this course with someone else.
She doesn't help students and was sometimes rude. I wouldn't take this class with her.
She doesn't help at all and is disorganized. Take it with another professor if possible.
Do not recommend

DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASSES WITH HER. She does not help the students whatsoever and is rude. If it weren't for the TAs I wouldn't have survived. The grading scheme is very weird and the cut off for an A- is 89%. If it weren't for that I would've gotten a A-. TAKE THIS CLASS WITH SOME OTHER PROF IF POSSIBLE.

The material isn't that hard, the curving was the worst idea, not everyone got the grade that they deserve. She is rude when you ask questions and usually is wrong herself.  Asking a question makes you more confused, which does discourage students from going up to her from help. TAs understood the material better than her..

Disorganized and unable to guide students/class properly (TAs carry every lab). Comes to labs late. Spends the first 15 to 40 minutes of the lab trying to give directions but ends up yapping. Gave the class a bonus assignment (originally not a bonus) then scaled everybody's grades back.
She is however, very lenient since the class is often a mess.

Very unclear grading scheme. She most likely changed it after the final because the averages were "too high". Minimum A- percent was 89%, not 85%. This was not specified anywhere before the final, nor was it specified until asked about. She loves to poke fun at students who ask her for help in her labs. She's overall a terrible instructor.
Was quite upset that she backscaled the entire class' grades down rather than providing people with the grade they earned.

Bad prof. Minimal material to prepare for Labs and Exams. Final exam was poorly formatted due to the fact that she wrote it at 3am. Her prelab talks are long and unnecessary, spending most her time talking about her kids and flexing her 6 figure salary on 18/19 year olds. Grades were 2 weeks late because the election was too interesting. Very lazy!

Took at least an hour to talk every lab, yet was strict on us finishing the lab early, the report sheets were marked fairly, but the final exam - which was written at 3am, in the worst format imaginable, was not. She curved us all down, and by the way does not curve up. And gave a bonus assignment just to regret it? Avoid if possible

She had changed the grading scale last minute because “the bonus assignment was worth too much”; she thought it would be best to make it harder to receive an A in this course to combat the weight of said assignment. We emailed her about this; she stated that she would not be responding to emails until the next term. Unprofessional at the least.

It's been 2 weeks since final grades were due by the dean still haven't gotten our grades back. She had to scale down in this class class average is 83 and so she made class average a b instead of a b+ like Surrey. Wtf is this man

She yaps for an hour and expects you to finish on time. There is a lot of students who don't. She made the final exam at 3 AM in the morning of when we were supposed to take it. It was the worst exam format I have ever seen e.g. having to explain the multiple choice section why it was right and every other option was wrong. Highest final mark was⬇️

Very disorganized, lab reports are marked fair because most of the time they are marked by the TAs, whenever she marks expect to almost fail. She openly admitted to being weak in electrochem, having to teach herself every semester before she teaches it. Took way too long to get our marks back after grades cutoff and sent us an email of excuses.

When I say skip please just wait another semester. Profs like this should not be allowed. Final grades are due tn. She emailed us with 6 excuses for all the 6 days she had to mark it. The dean is pissed at her apparently. Instead of admitting she has poor time management she had a “dance recital”, “technical issues”. She then blames the TA's
She is super unorganized and completely closed to any feedback, even when it's clear from all the mess in her classes...

Honestly avoid chem 126 with rebecca at all costs!! for a 2 credit course your workload is on par with a 3 or 4 credit course. Her labs are confusing, even the TA's were confused. The final was extremely difficult and she did not provide adequate information or give pre exam prep.

Where  do we begin. She spends 1st hour of lab talking about her personal life. She changes the lab last minute to confuse us. She comes to lab hours late and doesn't do a pre lab. I think she means well but sometimes she doesn't idk. It feels like she wanted to confuse you and doesn't have empathy

I was a TA for her for this lab but she's incredibly passive aggressive to the students. I've witnessed students asking her for help, each time I hear her criticize the student rather than help correct them with their mistake. "I don't even get how you made this mistake" is inappropriate. SFU needs to re-evaluate who they hire for this lab.

Very unorganized lab.Spends the 1st hr of lab talking about lab procedures and random personal stories and refuses to use a mic so nobody can even hear what's important or not.Gets mad at first year students for not knowing how to do an expt and is rude if you make a mistake.Passive aggressive when answering questions.Everyone confused even TA's.

Spends forever talking at the beginning of each lab. Minimal lab prep outside of LonCapa, but the techniques are simple enough. Lab work is done in pairs or groups, with her switching up who is paired with who in each row. Each class includes a written report sheet due at the end of lab, but the questions are usually similar to the LonCapa.
The pre-lab questions she has assigned are extremely difficult. It's hard to find information on how to solve the questions both in the textbook and in the lab manual.

Dr. Forde is a hit-or-miss professor. The labs are tough, but the TAs are supportive. Unstuck ai was a lifesaver for study prep - way better than just relying on the textbook. Overall, a challenging course, but manageable with the right resources.

Dr. Forde is a mediocre professor at best. He doesn't speak very loudly and the homework given for this class is insane (126 is 2 units). Expects you to have pretty everything written in your lab manual cut-and-paste into your notebook, which is very unnecessary. Not to mention there's pre-lab LONCAPA and he'll sneak up behind you during lab time.
A joke of a professor. Not too sure how he is able to be allowed to teach.
Not the best prof to take a course with. He is not helpful with questions the TAs were amazing tho.

Worst prof at sfu. Never take a class with. Drop course if possible. Horrible experience. Not very helpful with questions when asked. Seems like he doesnt know much and repeats everything you just asked him.
Nice guy but did not benefit me whatsoever in that lab. The TA's carried it hard.

Dr Forde's a decent human being when approached outside of class, but a bad teacher overall. His presence didn't make or break the lab experience for me, the labs were just generally hard/took a while. Marking for lab reports was sometimes slow but it was fair. TAs were always nice if not 100% knowledgeable. Midterm/final were easy.

126 was a difficult course and Dr. Forde exacerbated its quality. All he did during labs consisted of aimlessly walking around. He also provides minimal resources for students and speaks too quietly. A boring class with an even worse professor. I would NEVER take a class with Dr. Forde again.

First off she's an extremely nice lady and loves being around and helping her students.  Most of the labs weren't too bad except a couple that ran the whole time and a couple with long calculations.  For midterms make sure you go over loncapa questions and go over all of the labs in detail as that's were most of the questions come from.

Sophie is by far one of the best profs I've ever had, and for sure the nicest. Very helpful in labs when you screw up, and is more than happy to help you understand concepts. Most labs were fair, a few had some harder calculations, but most were based off of Lon-Capa. Midterms were hard~50% for both, but most of your mark is based off of lab work.

Sophie is hands down one of the most compassionate professors at SFU. She genuinely cares about her students and she's always willing to lend a hand if you need it. 8 out of the 11 labs are easy, the others require a bit more thinking, but prelabs will prep you well. Midterms were definitely difficult, final average was 51%!

Very nice professor, lab with her is super easy. Midterms were on the more difficult side, class avg was ~60% for each, but questions were based on lon-capa and lab descriptions. Lab write-ups were worth 50%, so make sure you put some effort into them! I didn't do well on the two midterms, but ended up with B+ in the course b/c of high lab marks.
Nice professor but is not able to communicate lab ideas effectively. The lab writeups are easier than 121, but the midterms are on the hard side.
her teaching is confusing and don't listen to her about midterm b/c it will be different from loncapa and exp...just go to office hour and ask ta's for help.

Sophie's a really nice prof. Her labs are straightforward business, marking based on accuracy and equations. For the exams, be sure to go over the lon-capa questions & lab intros in the manual! Both lab final and midterm were pretty tough, so come prepared! Overall, a pretty decent chem course.
I LOVE HER

this is a prof that actually gives a**** about students. wonderful professor, but very bad course material. i always felt lost during the labs, TAs are always bored as hell, they dont care they just wanna go home hahaha. lot of WORK for little grades.

Well the good news is that she's a nice and helpful prof, and also that the powerpoint presentations and prelab assignments make the labs pretty easy because you're pretty much doing the same thing that you did in the prelab. The bad news is that it is hard to study for the final because they won't let you see your quizzes and report sheets.

Best Lab prof ever!!! before i hated chem, but her style of teaching has encouraged me to see the brighter side of chem. Very patient and lets us take lab reports home (if you are monday lab).we made icecream for our final lab ^-^... Too bad she wont be teaching for 4 semister after this T.T    it was a blessing to have her for both 121 lab and 126
I hate chem labs, and I still do. But Dr.Lavieri is nice and understanding. Although average is high and scaled, still got an A-. I recommend taking this course with her.
Awesome prof, really helping  and considerate. Remembers her students and meets u like a friend outside the class. SMILE and take any class with her.
come in my children and have your 5 min quiz..." lol i had her for the summer..haha she's really good in chem :D she's really friendly  =)
Very friendly and approachable. Thick accent which made it challenging to understand her. Good TAs and her as a prof makes for a pretty fun lab, although the write ups can be every long.
Probably the sweetest lady ever. And a great prof. Someone does care about you in university..she's one of them!

The best lab instructor I have had. Delivers hilarious pre-lab lectures and is extremely helpful/approachable during the lab. Made chemistry fun and interesting. You can even get bonus marks. Final exam was fair.

One of the best profs I've had.  She truly cares that her students succeed and makes an effort to ensure they do.  Labs aren't too bad if you put in an effort (helps to have a smart lab partner too). I hate chem and never understood it, so if you're like me you'll probably bomb the final (51%) but I still got a B, so not bad.
A great prof,very helpful and friendly.cares for students.

She is a very sweet and helpful professor who more than cares for the students. Generally, her presence makes you quite comfortable.  She never seems to carry the "stamp" of a Professor, that you will notice in most others; she behaves more like a friend.  Regarding her tests, I think they are quite straight forward as long as you put in efforts
Sophie is incredibly friendly and helpful and she does a brilliant job of encouraging her students to do their best.  Made labs very enjoyable.

she a great lady.  Besides the fact the labs ere long, she really made a great effort to keep us interested and gives us a laugh or two.  very apporoachable and friendly! i'm signing up for chem 281!! that's how nice she is!
Amazing prof, she's so helpful and enthusiastic about chemistry and teaching.

she's the most enthusiastic n friendly prof! she's so interested in the subject n wants her students to do well. the labs r rushed n stressful though. if u'r takin chem 122 at the same time, make sure to schedule the lab at the end of the week so u can use the concepts learnt in class!
She's always happy and cheerful and very patient. A good teacher who explains things very well and doesn't get mad very easily.

What a wonderfully cheerful lab instructor! Not angry like Hanlan. Will explain concepts to you if you have troubles and yes, despite the accent which isn't all that bad, she relays info to you very clearly. Happy and smiley to all, I have never seen her mad.  I wish she was my mom :P
very good lab instructor, despite her accent, she delievers her messages clearly, she knows whats shes doing and is always around to help, and she will always be able to answer your problems!

SOOOO NICE!!! SHe is one of the best profs that I have had here. Her exams are totally fair, and she will go to awesome lengths to help her students. The report sheets are a little too long, and we should be allowed more time to finish them.
awesome prof!!! she is great!! just some of the quizzes are kindda hard!

Okay. She's a really nice person but I detested this course. The labs are all so rushed, the stress is just brutal. Eventually I associated her peppiness and voice with feeling terrible. So maybe i'm biased that way.
She is very enthusiastic and truly loves Chemistry!  Fun, happy prof!
her exams are sooo hard. i got a D with 68% in her class
helpful and a very nice prof
Most energetic prof i had so far, glad i took both Chem122/126 with her, excellent!!
she seems nice on the outside but shes not in the inside.....her exams are very tricky and she is not very clear about her expectation
She is a great prof, explains concepts very well, she really cares about the students and how well they do, exams are moderate, and you learn a lot from this course
Excellent prof, very enthusiastic!  I'm just kicking myself for taking CHEM 122 (which I took along with CHEM 126) this semester with Dr. Ghandi because Sophie will be teaching it next semester.
Sophine is VERY VERY nice & REALLY REALLY helpful.  The difficulty of the exams are reasonable(like what you expected).
Sophie Lavieri is a fantastic prof. Her love of chemistry certainly shows in her friendly and outgoing nature and she is always ready to provide extra help when needed.

Sophie Lavieri is an awesome professor.  I've had her for both Chem 121 and Chem 126.  She was great in both lab courses that I took, being very friendly and very encouraging.  She's extremely approachable and always there to help.
very kind, helpful, inspiring, polite
very nice and friendly prof...
definitely the best prof i've seen at sfu besides thong so far.  extremely enthusiastic..more like a friend than a prof, a very dedicated prof, they should promote her to an assistant prof =)
She's super friendly that it's scary! She encourages everyone to do well. Pleasant person.
She is super enthusiatic! Very very helpful all the time and always wants everybody to learn in the lab...NOT JUST STUCKING UP FOR AN ACCEPTABLE PASSING MARK!!
She makes this yucky course bearable!!! Always willing to help.
She is the most enthusiastic prof I've ever met! She always says  hi  and offers to help you. Great teacher!
Excellent lab professor.  She is very helpful, open to questions, and has a GREAT attitude.  Definately one of the best professors out there.
Very nice, kind and funny prof I've never seen! But it's quite hard ...
very nice prof!!
No Comments
The best professor in this god forsaken university
No Comments
Patient, clear, willing to help students, I like her enthusiasm.
encourages questions and is very eager to answer them.
very nice lectuer...always available for help...

Doesn't respond to emails, teaches confusingly, and at times doesn't even know the answers to the questions he's demonstrating. He comes in late fairly often, but doesn't make up the time. 
The slides he puts online have sections missing, so you have to come to class or get the missing parts from a friend.
You'll need to teach yourself this course.

he doesn't really teach much because its a lab but the lab overall is difficult and long but manageable. do all the pre lab work and read through the manual to become familiar with the procedure and pray you get lab partners that aren't stupid

never take this course with jenny wong, the labs are tough and she will not help you and tell you to read your lab manual, final was extremely terrible (33 mc) and she does not tell you what will be on it/what to expect, every question i asked her she could not answer and stared at me as if i was stupid, just don't even bother with her...
Good Prof. I liked her teaching style. Very helpful when I went to her office hours and she was able to clearly explain the chemistry concepts I needed help with.

Jenny is one of those profs who takes pleasure in watching students struggle, and makes the semester way harder than it needs to be. She is no help whatsoever, didn't teach a single topic, and when you ask her for help she is super sarcastic and tells you to go read your lab manual. One of the worst profs out there.  No formula sheet for final exam
She is not a very helpful instructor. Most of the course content must be self taught and she is not willing to help with understanding the material.
Lots of work in this course overall, and it is very confusing if you do not do the readings and come prepared! Unfortunately the TA's are not much help either.
Labs were fun, midterms were fair and he was very helpful during his office hours. As long as you are prepared for each lab his class was fairly easy to get a good grade in.
In order to do the lon-capa questions the lab manual did not have enough information so read the pages in the textbook. This is pretty easy course. Be aware of announced quizes.

Competely TERRIBLE CLASS (126)! DO NOT take it unless you absolutely have to. way way too much work considering its only 2 credits, almost no support in completing the prelab (which is a lot longer and difficult than for 121). Try to get a later lab section so other students can help you with is because the prof won't and the TAs too busy.
overall great prof

A very interesting, and helpful lab prof.  Exams and quizzes were fair, straight off the manual.  I missed the final exam and he spent the time looking through all our next sem's schedules (by email) so that he could match it up and make up the time for the make-up exam. A very ncie prof.  Had good TA's too.
He was a very good professor, made labs fun.  Exams were extremely fair and directly from the lab manual.  Overall, a terrific prof.

Easy lab class. Quizzes are from prelab. Lab sheets get hard half-way through the semester but you can ask around for help. Prof is VERY easy going. He is helpful and has a very fair final. One of the best profs i've had at SFU. Really wants students to do well. Overall, excellent prof!

Good prof, made the course easy.  Liked how he didn't brief the class because that meant we almost always got out of lab an hour early.  Available for help, marking was fair and he made the lab enjoyable.  Fun and easy course.

This prof does not brief the class as other lab profs , so be prepared ! He is mean because he answers your questions VERY LAST MIN !!  But the course is easy , so I dont think the prof is useful at all !!

Genuinly friendly and approachable - doesn't come off as students' enemy, unlike some lab instructors and TA's. Very willing to help, and to listen to students' concerns and questions. Questionable assignment of letter grades, thanks to the ol' bell curve. In our class, 86%= B+, 71.5%= C-. Go figure. I like receiving the mark I earn, but whatever.
Friendly guy, Didn't mention class was graded on the curve?!! Kinda important info! No instruction, learn on your own?
extremely laid back, tells you how to do report sheet questions and easy to get along with.
